snippet: Much of the investment bank’s higher revenue was contributed by the trading desks that have struggled the most in recent years.
abstract: Goldman Sachs reports first-quarter earnings of $2.8 billion, or $5.94 per share, up 40 percent from $2 billion, or $4.02 a share, in year-earlier period; bank hails better-than-expected results, firing back at recent criticism of its business model.
lead_paragraph: Much of the investment bank’s higher revenue was contributed by the trading desks that have struggled the most in recent years.

headline.main: Goldman Sachs Reports Robust Earnings as Trading Revives
headline.print_headline: Goldman Reports Robust Earnings and Defends Its Business Model
